Class House

  • java.lang.Object
    • House
  • public class House
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains information about a house, such as:
      1) the rooms of the house
      2) the global temperature
      3) the global humidity (when it is the case)
    Author:
    Bogdan-Andrei Buga
    Group 322CB
    Automatic Control and Computer Science
    Polytechnic University of Bucharest

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      House​(double g_tmp)
      Builds a new house where the humidity is neglected.
      House​(double g_tmp, double g_hmd)
      Builds a new house with all the necesary values in the parameters of the function.

      • House

        public House​(double g_tmp,
             double g_hmd)
        Builds a new house with all the necesary values in the parameters of the function.
        Parameters:
        g_tmp - the desired global temperature
        g_hmd - the desired global humidity value

      • House

        public House​(double g_tmp)
        Builds a new house where the humidity is neglected.
        Parameters:
        g_tmp - the desired global temperature

        Returns:

        Adds a new room in the house.
        Parameters:

      • triggerHeat

        public java.lang.String triggerHeat​(long ref_timestamp,
                                    boolean bonus)
        Returns a message which indicates if the temperature sensor devices must be activated in order to reach the desired global tempaerature.
        Parameters:
        ref_timestamp - the reference timestamp
        bonus - a boolean value which indicates if the humidity must be neglected or not (false = neglected, true = not neglected)
        Returns:
        "YES, if the weighted average of the temperature and surface is lower than the global temperature
        "NO", otherwise
